    def test_validate_config_multiple_errors_combined(self):
        """Test validate_config combines multiple unique name errors"""
        device1 = Mock()
        device1.validate = Mock()
        device1._properties = ["name"]
        device1.get.side_effect = lambda x: "device1" if x == "name" else None
        device1.__class__.__name__ = "Device"
        device1.__module__ = "snappi.device"
        device1.parent = None
    
        device2 = Mock()
        device2.validate = Mock()
        device2._properties = ["name"]
        device2.get.side_effect = lambda x: "device1" if x == "name" else None
        device2.__class__.__name__ = "Device"
        device2.__module__ = "snappi.device"
        device2.parent = None
    
        device3 = Mock()
        device3.validate = Mock()
        device3._properties = ["name"]
        device3.get.side_effect = lambda x: "device1" if x == "name" else None
        device3.__class__.__name__ = "Device"
        device3.__module__ = "snappi.device"
        device3.parent = None
    
        config = Mock()
        config.validate = Mock()
        config._properties = ["devices"]
        config.__class__.__name__ = "Config"
    
        devices_iter = Mock()
        devices_iter.__module__ = "snappi.devices"
        devices_iter.__iter__ = Mock(return_value=iter([device1, device2, device3]))
    
        config.get.side_effect = lambda x: devices_iter if x == "devices" else None
    
        with patch("builtins.hasattr", side_effect=lambda obj, attr: attr in ["_properties", "__module__", "__next__", "parent"]):
            with patch("builtins.dir", return_value=["__module__", "__next__"]):
                with patch("builtins.getattr", side_effect=lambda obj, attr, default=None: None if attr == "parent" else default):
                    self.api.snappi_config = config
    
                    with pytest.raises(NameError) as exc_info:
>                       self.validation.validate_config()
